III.	Facility Identification
The Amylu facility is located at 1400 West 44th Street in Chicago, Illinois. The facility produces sausage for retail sales. The NAICS code for the process at the facility is 311999.  Many areas of the facility are refrigerated to maintain temperature in the manufacturing and storage areas.

Amylu utilizes a regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, for refrigeration. One closed loop refrigeration system is utilized to maintain temperature in the manufacturing, dock, and storage coolers. Amylu has a total of 13,000 pounds of Anhydrous Ammonia onsite.

VI.	General Accidental Release Prevention Program
A prevention program is in place to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases in accordance with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119) and the EPA Risk Management Program.   However, as discussed throughout this document Amylu is continuously improving this program. 

This prevention program covers those processes that handle ammonia above the threshold quantity for both PSM and RMP rules. The first audit of the PSM and RMP programs is due by August 11, 2025, in compliance with the requirement to conduct PSM and RMP audits every three years.  The elements of the PSM / Program 3 prevention program and a brief

description are listed below.
 

	Employee Participation  Amylu has developed a site-specific employee participation plan that ensures employees, and their representatives are consulted when conducting and developing process hazard analyses and other information required to be developed under the PSM/RMP regulation.  In addition, the employee participation program will ensure employees, and their representatives have access to process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under PSM/RMP.
	Process Safety Information  Amylu maintains a site-specific PSI program that ensures information pertaining to the hazards, technology, and equipment of the process are properly developed and maintained.
	Process Hazard Analysis  Amylu has developed a site-specific PHA program that ensures a PHA is conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough to require a change in PSI.  In addition, this program ensures PHAs are conducted in accordance with OSHA and EPA regulations and ensures findings and recommendations of PHAs are properly documented. Amylu completed a thorough PHA study for the ammonia refrigeration system on November 14, 2024.
	Operating Procedures  Amylu has updated a site-specific procedure that ensures operating procedures provide clear instruction for different phases of process operations and ensures they are properly maintained.  
	Training  Amylu has developed a site-specific training procedure that ensures employees operating the ammonia process have the knowledge to safely operate the process, are aware of the potential hazards of the process, and understand the causes of process problems.
	Management of Change  Amylu has developed a site-specific management of change procedure that ensures changes (except for replacement in kind) to the ammonia process, such as additions of new equipment or changes in operating, maintenance, or other procedures are documented. 
	Pre-S

tartup Review  Amylu has developed a site-specific pre-startup safety review procedure that ensures a safety review is performed when modifications to the ammonia process are significant enough to require a change in PSI.
	Mechanical Integrity  Amylu has updated a site-specific mechanical integrity procedure that ensures written preventative maintenance procedures are developed and maintained, preventative maintenance tests and inspections are properly documented, and employees maintaining the process receive adequate training.
 
	Contractor Qualifications  Amylu has developed a site-specific contractor qualification procedure that ensures all contract employers safety performance and programs are evaluated, a contract employee injury and illness log is maintained, information of potential hazards are communicated between Amylu and the contract employer, and required training and information is communicated, such as the provisions of the emergency action plan and control over entrance into process areas.
	Incident Investigation  Amylu has developed a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly addressed. 
	Compliance Audit  Amylu has developed a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that Amylu PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed.  The first compliance audit must be completed August 11, 2025. 
	Hot Work Permits  Amylu has developed a best management practice for hot work and hot work permits.

VII.	Five-Year Accident History
The Amylu facility has not had an accidental anhydrous ammonia

release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the last five years.

VIII.	Emergency Action Program
Amylu has developed an emergency action plan to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release.  

Amylu has communicated and trained facility employees on proper evacuation procedures and has had interaction with the Chicago Fire Department. In addition, the facility has coordinated their emergency action plan with the Cook County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).   

Although Amylu does not have an onsite hazardous materials response team, selected individuals have received HAZWOPER training through classroom instruction, on-the-job training, and drills.  The current HAZWOPER training includes the first responder awareness level, the first responder operations level, and hazardous materials technician training.  

The facility has windsocks present onsite for use in determining wind direction in the event of an ammonia release and evacuation of the building.

The current Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for anhydrous ammonia is included in Appendix E. 

IX.	Emergency Communications
The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are included in the facilitys Emergency Action Plan.  

X.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Chemical safety is an important part of Amylus operations. Amylu recently conducted a process hazard analysis (PHA) of the ammonia refrigeration system and is dutifully implementing the recommendations from that study. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Amylu.  

XI.	Management Program
Amylu has developed a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.
